#Text=Evangelos Koukoudeas
#Text=Evangelos Koukoudeas in the early 20th century .
#Text=Evangelos Koukoudeas ( Greek : Ευάγγελος Κουκουδέας ) was a Greek chieftain of the Macedonian Struggle and hero of the Balkan Wars .
#Text=Biography
#Text=Koukoudeas was bornt in Üstrümce , then part of the Ottoman Empire ( now Strumica , North Macedonia ) at the end of the 19th century .
#Text=He came from an old and important family of Strumica .
#Text=Famous relatives of him were the violinist Dimitrios Koukoudeas or Semsis and the teacher of Strumica 's Girls ' School , Aikaterini Koukoudea .

#Text=After graduating from the Greek school in his hometown , he travelled to Athens in 1905 to escape the Bulgarian attacks and to be enrolled in the armed groups being gathered for the Macedonian Struggle . [ 1 ]
#Text=He was also enlisted in the Hellenic Navy as a leading seaman .
#Text=Macedonian Struggle
#Text=After his military service , he went to Macedonia and fought in the region of the Giannitsa Lake under the general command of Ioannis Demestichas .

#Text=On February 14 , 1907 , the united Greek bodies under Demestichas , Evangelos Koukoudeas , Nikolaos Zafeiriou from Chalkidiki and several other Macedonian and Cretan soldiers active in the Lake started from Tsekri ( modern Paralimni ) and attacked the komitadji K. Delithanasis , in Bozej ( modern Athyra ) .
#Text=The attack was successful , killing the komitadji and several of his men barricaded in the former 's home .
#Text=Eventually they left as an Ottoman military detachment appeared in the village .
#Text=In March 1907 , he was the leader of a small group involved in operations against komitadjis in Koufalia . [ 2 ]
#Text=He fought in the area of the Lake until the end of the Macedonian Struggle .
#Text=The chieftain Evangelos Koukoudeas
#Text=Ioannis Demestichas wrote about Koukoudeas ( translation from Greek ) : [ 3 ]
#Text=...
#Text=His long hair , and his modesty remind the hero of the Revolution Athanasios Diakos .
#Text=He overflows from patriotic enthusiasm , controlled enthusiasm , without exaggerations .
#Text=... I had full confidence on him and I was sure he would do his job under the most difficult circumstances .
#Text=He would rather die fighting than abandon me in case of danger. .
#Text=Balkan Wars
#Text=Before the Balkan Wars , during the Italo-Turkish War ( 1911-1912 )

#Text=while the Italians had occupied the Dodecanese , he went to Icaria and helped Ioannis Malachias in the revolution against the Ottomans in July 1912 , that set up the Free State of Icaria to prevent the island from being occupied by the Italians

#Text=He then created a group of Icarian volunteers for participation in the First Balkan War and disembarked in Chios on 14 December 1912 , where he took part in the Battle of Volissos and the Battle of Aipos during the Greek occupation of the island . [ 3 ] [ 4 ]
#Text=Northern Epirus , First World War and Greco-Turkish War
#Text=After the end of the Balkan Wars he fought for the Autonomous Republic of Northern Epirus .

#Text=He then moved to the United States of America , where after the National Defence coup d'état in Thessaloniki and Greece 's entry into World War I , he organized a militia to facilitate the transfer of volunteers to Greece .
#Text=During the World War he fought as a reserve infantry officer , and was eventually commissioned into the Greek Army as a second lieutenant .
#Text=He participated in the Greco-Turkish War ( 1919 – 1922 ) , where he was captured by the Turks .
#Text=After his liberation and the end of the war , he continued his career with the Greek Army , reaching the rank of colonel . [ 3 ]
